Name: Orange Brûlée
Ingredients: 45 ml Grand Marnier or other cognac orange liqueur
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Prepare garnish of chocolate powder or grated nutmeg.
FLOAT thin layer of cream evenly over cocktail.
Garnish with a dusting of chocolate powder or freshly grated nutmeg.
Review: A great-looking creamy topped after-dinner cocktail.
History: Created in 2005 by Xavier Laigle at Bar le Forum in Paris, France.
Nutrition: One serving of Orange Brûlée contains 347 calories
